intro: Sclerochorton junceum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are yellow and produce small seeds with parachute-like structures. Sclerochorton junceum is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to arid conditions.
